Creamy Stovetop Mac and Cheese

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the ultimate comfort food experience with our **Creamy Stovetop Mac and Cheese** recipe! This dish is not just a childhood favorite; it’s a creamy, dreamy delight that satisfies cravings at any age. Perfectly cooked elbow macaroni is enveloped in a luscious cheese sauce made from sharp cheddar and rich cream cheese, creating a velvety texture that’s simply irresistible. Whether you’re looking for a quick weeknight dinner, a cozy meal on a rainy day, or a crowd-pleasing side for a family gathering, this stovetop mac and cheese is the answer. With just a handful of ingredients, including macaroni, butter, milk, and cheese, you can whip up this cheesy masterpiece in no time. Join us as we guide you through easy steps to create a dish that not only warms the heart but also brings everyone together around the dinner table. Let’s dive into the creamy goodness!

Ingredients

elbow macaroni

Elbow macaroni is a classic choice for mac and cheese, but you can substitute it with other small pasta shapes like shells, cavatappi, or fusilli. For a healthier option, consider whole wheat or gluten-free pasta. To enhance the texture, you can slightly undercook the pasta (1-2 minutes less than the package instructions) as it will continue to cook when combined with the sauce.

water

Using filtered water can improve the overall flavor of your dish. You can also replace some of the water with broth (chicken or vegetable) for added flavor when boiling the pasta.

salt

Salt is essential for flavor; be sure to add it to the boiling water before adding the pasta. If you're watching sodium intake, you can reduce the amount or use low-sodium salt alternatives. Taste the final dish before serving, as the cheese will also add saltiness.

butter

Butter adds richness and flavor. For a healthier alternative, you can substitute with olive oil or margarine, but be aware that this may alter the flavor slightly. Consider using unsalted butter to have more control over the saltiness of your dish.

milk

Whole milk will give you the creamiest texture, but you can substitute with 2% milk or a non-dairy milk (like almond or oat milk) for a lighter version. For a richer flavor, consider adding a splash of heavy cream or half-and-half.

cheddar cheese, shredded

While sharp cheddar is traditional, feel free to mix in other cheeses like mozzarella, gouda, or Monterey Jack for a more complex flavor. Pre-shredded cheese often contains anti-caking agents that can affect melting, so shredding your own cheese is recommended for a smoother sauce.

cream cheese

Cream cheese adds creaminess and tang. You can substitute it with mascarpone or ricotta cheese if you prefer a different flavor profile. Adding a little sour cream can also enhance the creaminess.

black pepper

Black pepper adds a nice kick to the dish. For a twist, consider using white pepper for a milder flavor, or add a pinch of cayenne or smoked paprika for extra depth and heat. Freshly cracked black pepper will provide better flavor than pre-ground.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Boil Water

    In a large pot, bring 4 cups of water and 1 teaspoon of salt to a boil. This helps to season the pasta as it cooks, enhancing the flavor.

  • Step 2: Cook Elbow Macaroni

    Add 2 cups of elbow macaroni to the boiling water and cook according to package instructions, usually about 8-10 minutes, until al dente. It's important not to overcook the pasta, as it will continue to cook slightly when mixed with the cheese sauce.

  • Step 3: Drain Pasta

    Once the pasta is cooked, drain it in a colander and return it to the pot. This keeps the pasta warm and ready for the cheese sauce.

  • Step 4: Add Butter

    Over low heat, add 2 tablespoons of butter to the pasta and stir until melted. This step adds richness and helps the cheese sauce adhere to the pasta.

  • Step 5: Mix in Milk and Cheeses

    Pour in 1 cup of milk, then add 2 cups of shredded cheddar cheese and 4 ounces of cream cheese. The milk adds creaminess, while the combination of cheeses creates a rich flavor.

  • Step 6: Stir Until Smooth

    Stir continuously until the cheeses melt and the sauce is creamy and smooth. Keep the heat low to avoid burning the cheese.

  • Step 7: Season and Serve

    Season with black pepper to taste and serve hot. You can also sprinkle some extra cheese on top for added flavor.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I know when my pasta is cooked 'al dente'?

'Al dente' means the pasta is cooked but still firm to the bite. To check, taste a piece a minute or two before the package's recommended cooking time. It should be tender but not mushy.

What should I do if my cheese sauce is too thick?

If your cheese sauce is too thick, you can add a little more milk, a tablespoon at a time, while stirring over low heat until you reach your desired consistency.

Is it necessary to add salt to the pasta water?

Yes! Adding salt to the pasta water enhances the flavor of the pasta. It’s your chance to season the noodles from the inside out.

How can I prevent the cheese from clumping when making the sauce?

To prevent clumping, make sure your cheese is at room temperature before adding it to the warm pasta. Stir continuously and allow the heat to gradually melt it.

What’s the best way to store leftover mac and cheese?

Allow the mac and cheese to cool, then transfer it to an airtight container. It can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days. Reheat gently on the stovetop or microwave, adding a splash of milk if needed.

What tools do I need to make this mac and cheese?

You will need a large pot for boiling the pasta, a colander for draining, and a wooden spoon or spatula for stirring the cheese sauce. A measuring cup and spoons will also help with ingredient amounts.

Can I add other ingredients to my mac and cheese?

Absolutely! You can mix in cooked vegetables (like broccoli or peas), proteins (like ham or chicken), or spices (like paprika or garlic powder) to customize your dish.

How can I make my mac and cheese even creamier?

For an extra creamy texture, consider adding a bit of sour cream or using a combination of different cheeses, such as mozzarella or gouda, along with the cheddar.

What if I don't have cream cheese?

If you don’t have cream cheese, you can substitute it with an equal amount of ricotta or skip it entirely. Just make sure to add a bit more milk to maintain creaminess.

How do I clean up melted cheese from pots and pans?

To clean melted cheese, soak the pot or pan in warm, soapy water for a bit before washing. For stubborn bits, simmer some water in it to loosen the cheese, then scrub gently.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a vegetarian version, ensure that the cheese used is rennet-free. To make it gluten-free, substitute elbow macaroni with gluten-free pasta. For a lighter option, use low-fat milk and reduced-fat cheese. If you're looking for a dairy-free alternative, use plant-based cheese and milk to achieve a similar creamy texture while accommodating lactose intolerance or vegan diets.

Pairings

For a delightful meal, serve the creamy stovetop mac and cheese alongside crispy fried chicken or grilled vegetables. For a lighter option, a fresh arugula salad with lemon vinaigrette complements the richness of the mac and cheese beautifully. As for beverages, pair with a crisp white wine such as Chardonnay or a light beer like a pilsner. For non-alcoholic options, a sparkling lemonade or iced tea would enhance the meal.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the mac and cheese in warm, shallow bowls to highlight its creamy texture. Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh parsley or chives for a pop of color and freshness. Offer additional toppings on the side, such as crispy bacon bits, extra shredded cheese, or breadcrumbs for added crunch. To make it more of a comfort food experience, serve with a side of garlic bread or a warm, soft dinner roll.

Creamy Stovetop Mac and Cheese

20 min
$6.5
450 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

DairyGluten

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

Course:

Tags:

QuickComfort FoodCheesyKid-Friendly

Description

A rich and creamy macaroni and cheese that's quick to make and full of cheesy goodness!

Ingredients

  • elbow macaroni: 2 cups
  • water: 4 cups
  • salt: 1 teaspoon
  • butter: 2 tablespoons
  • milk: 1 cup
  • cheddar cheese, shredded: 2 cups
  • cream cheese: 4 ounces
  • black pepper: to taste

11/21/2024
